column4: that's normal if you don't have any other OSes installed (no menu displayed, grub boots OS directly)
it doesn't load an OS though
what's the last line before it reboots?
ok, are you able to boot anything? memtest86?
has it ever been working?
I mean, this install.
I'd try a reinstall then, repartition your harddrive.
ok, how did you partition it?
what kind of computer is this?
the problem is your /boot partition you see.
BIOS date?
just use the ubuntu installer to remove the partitions.. but make /boot ext2 not ext3
I'm going to try this one more time.
that's weird.
it shouldn't be any problem
I've looked up error 18 to be sure, and yes... it's due to the /boot partition not being placed at the beginning of the harddrive.
are you running the latest BIOS btw?
don't install WinNT, just use a floppy
just download
isn't it just a .img file? dd if=image.img of=/dev/floppy
ok.. it's not a floppy image.
